newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline firms.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline firms.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline basis firmed on steady differentials and a late-day rebound in front-month NYMEX unleaded prices, traders said.

Low sulphur diesel differentials in Chicago and Group Three were unchanged as trade wound down for the week, sending cash prices surging higher on gains in NYMEX front-month heating oil prices, traders said.
Traders remained bearish on the outlook for spot products prices in the Midwest due to a perceived glut of petroleum products -- particularly low sulhur diesel -- in the market.
High sulphur diesel remained 0.50/0.25 cent a gallon under October heating oil in both Chicago and Group Three, traders said. Low sulphur differentials also were steady in both markets.
Chicago late-September unleaded gasoline was unchanged at 1.50/1.25 cents under the print, with premium talked 2.75 cents higher.
Group Three prompt unleaded gasoline was steady at 1.0/0.75 cent a gallon under the print, with premium steady at 2.50 cents higher.
Jet/kero was unchanged in discussion late Friday at 3.0/3.25 cents over the print in Chicago and 2.75/3.0 cents over the print in Group Three.
